alfredsnippet.snippet:
Science, 31 August 1973

"The supreme factor in clear writing cannot be communicated, and is not always learned in a lifetime of experience: it is wisdom. A science exists as a vast depository of facts and theories, from which must be chosen a few significant and central themes. To shape a subject in the mind requires more than technical knowledge: it demands that 'desire and pursuit of the whole' called natural philosophy. The style is the man."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Natural Philosophy
